title: Project Management Fundamentals
description: Vocabulary for project lifecycles and future tenses for discussing deadlines.

items.explanation: Closure is the final phase where lessons learned are reviewed and the project is finalized.
items.prompt: In which project phase do we conduct a final review and document lessons learned?

items.explanation: Future Perfect: will have + past participle for completion before a deadline.
items.prompt: By the end of this month, we ________ (complete) the initiation phase of the new project.

items.explanation: A deliverable is any tangible or intangible result of project work.
items.prompt: What is the term for a specific product or result that must be produced to complete a project?

items.explanation: Future Continuous: will be + -ing for an action in progress in the future.
items.prompt: Don't call me at 10 AM tomorrow; I ________ (attend) the project planning meeting.

items.explanation: Scope creep refers to the uncontrolled growth of a project's requirements.
items.prompt: What occurs when a project's requirements expand without additional time or budget?

items.explanation: A milestone is a significant event or stage.
items.prompt: Reaching our first 1,000 users was a major ________ for the startup.

items.explanation: A Gantt chart is a visual tool used for project scheduling.
items.prompt: Which visual tool is commonly used by project managers to track schedules and tasks?
I hope the client ________ (approve) the budget by the time we start the execution phase.

items.explanation: Future Perfect ('will have finished') indicates completion before a specific point in time.
items.prompt: Which tense is best for saying 'I expect to be done with the report by Friday'?

items.explanation: To delegate is to assign tasks to others.
items.prompt: To manage your time effectively, you need to ________ some of your more routine tasks to the administrative assistant.
